column2: DEVINSSI - MAS DE LES VALLS WHITE
column3:
AGING: Fermented in stainless steel tanks under strict temperature control. Bottle-aged to achieve complexity and balance. 

VIEW: Pale golden color, clean and transparent.

BOUQUET: Evokes the characteristic aromas of the Priorat undergrowth — thyme, fennel, bay leaf — combined with notes of baked apples, tropical fruits, aromatic herbs, and linden blossom.

MOUTH: Warm on the palate, with balanced acidity and good persistence. The aftertaste is subtly smoky and long-lasting.

PRODUCTION: Handcrafted production of only 600 bottles per vintage — a truly unique white wine from a region where 95% of the vineyards are dedicated to red varieties.

column3:
AGING: Aged for a minimum of 30 months on the lees, providing great aromatic and palate complexity with mature fruit nuances and elegant notes from extended aging.

VIEW: Straw yellow with golden-copper reflections. Fine, persistent bubbles with a well-maintained crown and medium tears.

BOUQUET: On the nose, aromas of ripe fruits (banana, peach, baked apple), citrus, and long-aging notes such as sweet spices, dried fruits (almond, walnut), dry yeast, mushroom, and pastry (cream, brioche), over hints of dried flowers and hay.

MOUTH: Creamy and well-integrated bubbles with a silky texture. Rich and polished from the aging, balanced by citrus acidity (dried mandarin peel, grapefruit). Flavors of candied fruits (apricot, apple) with a subtle earthy finish and a refreshing balsamic-herbal aftertaste.

FOOD PAIRING: Versatile cava, ideal from start to finish of a meal: cold and hot starters, braised meats, baked fish. Also an excellent aperitif on warmer days.

column2: AGW MASSIMO ILEGAL & CLANDESTINO LIQUOR CAFÉ
column3:
AGING: The defining feature of this limited edition coffee liqueur is its slow cold maceration, lasting over 7 months. Made from a single coffee variety, naturally roasted in Guatemala's Huehuetenango region, the coffee is roasted on the same day maceration begins to preserve its sensory qualities. Spices and citrus peels are added, and the mixture is stirred daily for optimal aroma and body extraction. After removing the ingredients, the liqueur is sweetened with caramel and left to rest for several months before filtration and bottling.

VIEW: It has an intense dark chestnut color.

BOUQUET: Elegant aroma of naturally roasted coffee with subtle hints of toffee caramel, dark chocolate, and vanilla.

MOUTH: It is smooth and rich on the palate, with dominant notes of coffee and citrus peel, leaving an elegant bitter finish.

LIMITED PRODUCTION: 428 numbered bottles.
